Package com.andreasmenzel.adds_dji.Managers

Class DJIManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.andreasmenzel.adds_dji.Managers.DJIManager
  • public class DJIManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manager for the DJI product. This is the higher-level interface between the app and the DJI product. Updates the information holders and provides methods to control the drone via high-level operation modes.

      • productConnected

        @Subscribe
public void productConnected​(ProductConnected event)
        This is executed when a DJI product was connected. Sets up the callback methods to retrieve information about the drone.

      • productChanged

        @Subscribe
public void productChanged​(ProductChanged event)
        This is executed when the DJI product was changed. Sets up the callback methods to retrieve information about the drone IF a product is now connected.

        public static boolean isAircraftConnected()
        Checks if an aircraft is currently connected (could also be a handheld device).
        Returns:

      • setupBatteryStateCallback

        private void setupBatteryStateCallback()
        Sets up the battery state callbacks. Makes sure that the SDK starts the processUpdatedBatteryState(...) method when the battery state changes.

      • processUpdatedBatteryState

        private void processUpdatedBatteryState​(@NonNull
                                        dji.common.battery.BatteryState batteryState)
        This method is called whenever the battery state of the connected product changed. Executes the appropriate method(s) that update the information holder(s).
        Parameters:
        batteryState - The new battery state.

      • processUpdatedBatteryStateUpdateAircraftPower

        private void processUpdatedBatteryStateUpdateAircraftPower​(@NonNull
                                                           dji.common.battery.BatteryState batteryState)
        Updates the AircraftPower from an updated flight battery state.
        Parameters:
        batteryState - The new battery state.

      • setupFlightControllerStateCallback

        private void setupFlightControllerStateCallback()
        Sets up the flight controller state callbacks. Makes sure that the SDK starts the processUpdatedFlightControllerState(...) method when the battery state changes.

      • processUpdatedFlightControllerState

        private void processUpdatedFlightControllerState​(@NonNull
                                                 dji.common.flightcontroller.FlightControllerState flightControllerState)
        This method is called whenever the flight controller state of the connected product changed. Executes the appropriate methods that update the information holders.
        Parameters:
        flightControllerState - The new flight controller state.

      • processUpdatedFlightControllerStateUpdateAircraftLocation

        flightControllerState - The new flight controller state.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()

      • virtualStick

        public void virtualStick()
        Changes the high-level operation mode to StartVirtualStick(). The high-level operation mode then automatically changes to UseVirtualStick() and the virtualStickFlightControlData is sent to the SDK.

      • virtualStickAddLeft

        public void virtualStickAddLeft()

                                              float altitude)

      • changeOperationMode

        public static void changeOperationMode​(OperationMode newOperationMode)
        Changes the high-level operation mode. This also performs some checks and potential cleanup depending on the mode currently active.
        Parameters:
        newOperationMode - The new high-level operation mode.

      • resetVirtualStickFlightControlData

        private static void resetVirtualStickFlightControlData()
        Resets the virtual stick flight control data. This is done so that the drone doesn't act unpredictable when starting the virtual stick mode and not updating the flight control data.

      • controlDrone

        public void controlDrone()
        Starts the drone control loop.

      • controlDrone

        public void controlDrone​(boolean active)
        Controls the drone depending on the high-level operation mode currently active. This method has to be executed periodically, at least a few times per second.
        Parameters:
        active - If true, continue the drone control loop. If false, stop the drone control loop.
